question: How to renew student visa?
answer: Renew your student residence and then book TOMA DE HUELLAS for the TIE card.
steps: Prepare passport copy, EX-17, photo, tasa 790-012 receipt
Book 'Policía – Toma de huellas' in Barcelona
Bring documents to the appointment

question: How to book Toma de huellas appointment in Barcelona?
answer: Book online at ICP portal. Slots open daily at 8:00 AM and disappear very fast.
steps: Go to icp.administracionelectronica.gob.es
Select Province: Barcelona
Choose 'POLICÍA – TOMA DE HUELLAS (EXPEDICIÓN DE TARJETA)'
Check at 8:00 AM daily for new slots

question: What documents do I need for TIE card application?
answer: You need passport with entry stamp, empadronamiento, EX-17 form, photo, tasa 790-012 receipt, and health insurance.
steps: Passport + copy of photo page and entry stamp
Empadronamiento issued less than 3 months ago
1 color photo 32×26 mm white background
Paid Tasa 790-012 receipt (€16.08)
Harbour.Space enrollment letter
Health insurance policy

question: Can I travel in Europe with Spanish TIE card?
answer: Yes, you can travel within Schengen area with your TIE card and passport for up to 90 days in any 180-day period.
steps: Always carry both TIE card and passport
Check validity dates before travel
Keep digital copies as backup

question: What is Student Visa Type D?
answer: Student Visa Type D is for studies longer than 90 days in Spain. Valid up to 1 year, renewable, allows work up to 20 hours per week.
steps: Apply at Spanish consulate 3 months before classes
Prepare financial proof (€600/month minimum)
Get health insurance with €30,000 coverage
Book consular appointment early

question: How to get a work permit as a student?
answer: You can apply for a part-time work authorization via your university with a job offer and valid TIE.
steps: Get a written job offer (hours within student limits)
Check your university guidance office
Submit request with your current student card (TIE)

question: How many hours can a student work in Spain?
answer: Students with Type D visa can work up to 20 hours per week or part-time during studies.
steps: Check your visa conditions
Ensure work doesn't interfere with studies
Get written job offer before applying for authorization

question: What is Social Security Number (NUSS) and how to get it?
answer: NUSS is your Social Security number needed for legal work in Spain. You can get it online via Import@ss portal in 5 minutes.
steps: Go to portal.seg-social.gob.es
Select 'Solicitar NUSS' under Altas y modificaciones
Log in with SMS code (accepts foreign numbers since March 2025)
Download PDF confirmation instantly

question: Do students pay taxes in Spain?
answer: If you work, you file IRPF annually; many students have simple returns.
steps: Collect payslips and NIE/TIE
Use Agencia Tributaria portal to file
Check thresholds and deductions for students

question: How to find student housing in Barcelona?
answer: Use verified portals like Idealista, Spotahome, HousingAnywhere, or join Harbour.Space Discord #housing channel.
steps: Check Harbour.Space Discord #housing channel first
Search on Idealista.com, Spotahome, HousingAnywhere
Avoid scams: never pay before video tour
Confirm landlord allows empadronamiento before signing

question: What is empadronamiento and why do I need it?
answer: Empadronamiento is city residency registration. Mandatory for NIE/TIE, bank account, healthcare, and staying in Spain over 6 months.
steps: Book appointment at OAC (Oficina d'Atenció Ciutadana)
Bring passport, rental contract (≥6 months), and utility bill
Landlord or representative must attend with you
Get certified copy (volant) for future admin tasks

question: How much is typical rent in Barcelona for students?
answer: Furnished room in shared flat: €500-850 depending on neighborhood. Poblenou (near campus): €550-750. Whole 1-bedroom: from €1,100.
steps: Poblenou (near Harbour.Space): €550-750, 15 min walk
Born/Gothic: €600-800, 10 min bike
Eixample: €650-850, 20 min metro
Sant Martí/Clot: €500-700, budget-friendly

question: What is fianza (deposit) in Spain?
answer: Fianza is rental deposit, maximum 2 months' rent. Landlord must lodge it with INCASÒL and give you receipt.
steps: Confirm deposit amount in contract (max 2 months)
Get INCASÒL receipt from landlord
Take photos of apartment condition
Landlord must return deposit within 30 days after checkout

question: How to get from Barcelona airport to city center?
answer: Cheapest: Metro L9 (€5.70, 45 min) or R2 Nord train from T2 (€2.55, 27 min to Passeig de Gràcia). Fastest: Aerobús (€7.45, 35 min) or taxi (€35-40).
steps: Metro L9: every 7 min, change at Collblanc or Torrassa
R2 Nord train: only from T2, free shuttle from T1
Aerobús: 24h service, WiFi, direct to Plaça Catalunya
Night buses N16/N17: 02:00-05:00 when metro closed

question: What is T-Jove card and how to get it?
answer: T-Jove is unlimited 90-day travel pass for under-30s in Barcelona. Costs €44 and includes 8,000 discounts across Catalonia.
steps: Must be 30 years old or younger
Apply online or at TMB office
Bring passport/TIE and proof of age
Valid for unlimited metro, bus, tram, FGC for 90 days

question: What is T-Casual card in Barcelona?
answer: T-Casual is 10-trip ticket for €12.55 (Zone 1). Saves 50% per ride but NOT valid for airport metro.
steps: Buy at metro stations or TMB app
10 trips for €12.55 in Zone 1
Can be shared with friends
NOT valid for Metro L9 airport stations

question: How to get CatSalut health card (TSI)?
answer: Get INSS healthcare certificate first, then apply online for TSI. You'll receive plastic card in 10 days and digital TSI instantly.
steps: Get INSS healthcare certificate at seg-social.es
Apply online at salut.gencat.cat
Upload: INSS certificate, passport/TIE, empadronamiento, photo
Download digital TSI from La Meva Salut app immediately

question: What to do in medical emergency in Barcelona?
answer: Call 112 for emergencies. Ambulances and ER visits are free with CatSalut TSI card. For non-emergency, visit your local CAP.
steps: Emergency: call 112 (English available)
Show your TSI card or passport at hospital
Non-emergency: book appointment at local CAP
Call 061 Salut Respon for health advice

question: How to open a Spanish bank account as a student?
answer: Most banks offer free student accounts. Santander Cuenta Joven is free for ages 18-28. N26 is 100% digital and instant.
steps: Bring passport/TIE and empadronamiento
Get Spanish mobile number first
Santander: visit C/ de la Marina 102, ask for María (+34 691 14 63 42)
N26: open online with video ID in minutes

question: What documents do I need to open a bank account in Spain?
answer: You need passport or TIE/NIE, Spanish mobile number, and proof of address (empadronamiento). Some banks accept passport + empadronamiento while TIE is pending.
steps: Passport or TIE/NIE (resguardo accepted if TIE pending)
Empadronamiento or proof of address (less than 3 months)
Spanish mobile number for SMS codes
Student enrollment letter (sometimes requested)

question: How to get a Spanish SIM card?
answer: Buy prepaid SIM at any operator store with your passport. Best student options: Digi IlimiTODO (€12 unlimited), Lowi 50GB (€8), Orange Go 50GB (€10).
steps: Bring passport or TIE to any operator store
Digi: €12/month unlimited data and calls
Lowi: €8/month 50GB + unlimited calls
Orange: €10/month 50GB + unlimited calls
Activation requires ID by EU law

question: Can I use eSIM in Spain?
answer: Yes, Vodafone, Movistar, and Orange offer eSIM. Digital providers like Airalo sell Spain eSIMs (10GB for €9) but usually pricier than local SIM.
steps: Vodafone: eSIM available at airport kiosks
Movistar/Orange: eSIM via app for contract lines
Airalo/Nomad: instant eSIM online, good for tourists
Local SIM usually cheaper for long-term students

question: What is Digital Certificate (FNMT) and why do I need it?
answer: Digital Certificate is your secure e-ID for Spanish bureaucracy. Needed for filing taxes, NIE/TIE renewals, viewing vida laboral, and signing documents online.
steps: Get via video-identification (fastest, €2.99, 1 hour)
Go to sede.fnmt.gob.es
Upload selfie + passport scan
Download .pfx certificate and install
Valid for 4 years

question: How to renew student residence permit (prórroga)?
answer: Submit renewal 60 days before TIE expires via MERCURIO online platform. Need EX-00 form, enrollment proof, financial means (€600/month), and updated empadronamiento.
steps: Apply 60 days before expiry (latest: 90 days after)
Upload via MERCURIO platform online
Documents: EX-00, passport, TIE, enrollment, transcript, insurance, empadronamiento, Tasa 790-052
Get resguardo receipt to prove legal stay
Processing: up to 3 months

question: When is Harbour.Space orientation day?
answer: Orientation Day is typically on Day 3 after arrival. You'll collect student ID, log into campus WiFi, and join WhatsApp/Discord channels.
steps: Attend Welcome Session on Day 3
Collect your student ID card
Connect to campus WiFi
Join Harbour.Space Discord and WhatsApp groups
First Personal Plan meeting at end of Week 1

question: How to contact Harbour.Space student support?
answer: Email student.experience@harbour.space for general questions or academics@harbour.space for academic matters.
steps: General support: student.experience@harbour.space
Academic questions: academics@harbour.space
Join Discord for community help
Check Notion Student Info page for guides
